result.execSummary:
The defendant Ned E Love was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: "Domestic Abuse"=Act/Create Fear], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 8 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 3 and Milwaukee County Case 07CF1084, if revoked.
Consecutive to: Milwaukee County Case 07CF1084 but CONCURRENT to Count 3.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge and sample are waived by the Court.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Domestic Violence or Anger Management Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 8 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 2 and Milwaukee County Case 07CF1084, if revoked.
Consecutive to: Milwaukee County Case 07CF1084 but CONCURRENT to Count 2.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 2.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ned E Love in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both counts 2 & 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 2 & 3.
Repeater enhancers are struck on both counts 2 & 3.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Count 2:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Concurrent to: Count 3 and Milwaukee County Case:  07CF1084
8 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation.: 9 Months.
Consecutive to:  Milwaukee County Case:  07CF1084
Concurrent to count 3.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
D.V. or Anger Management Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violent contact with:  victim listed in the complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge: $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives both Sample and Surcharge.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.




Count 3:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Concurrent to: Count 2 and Milwaukee County Case:  07CF1084.
8 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 9 Months.
Consecutive to:  Milwaukee County Case:  07CF1084
Concurrent to count 2.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 2.

Costs:  $243  
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ned E Love in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ned E Love in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ned E Love in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Atty. Fragoso moves to modify bail.  State objects to any modification of bail.  Court denies the motion.  Bail remains as fixed.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
